description: Phex is alert, playful, and a bit of an acrobat, which means you should have a high, escape-proof fence around your property. Phex needs a job and would be well-suited for athletic activities, so he's looking for people who are also active. He has been and is still being worked with at the animal shelter; he's mastered the basics of dog training and enjoys learning. We're looking for experienced people for Phex who can keep him mentally and physically active and stimulated. He's only moderately compatible with other dogs (female dogs are generally accepted). Phex takes a while to accept new people, but once he's gained trust, he's a loyal companion.

Der Labrador Mischling Tobi kam zusammen mit Paco von einem unserer Mitgliedvereine zu uns auf den Sonnenhof. Ursprünglich kamen die beiden in ein Tierheim, da ihre Vorbesitzer leider verstorben sind.
Er liebt es, zu spielen besonders mit Bällen und ist für Leckerlis immer zu begeistern. An der Leine zieht Tobi noch recht kräftig, doch er ist lernwillig und braucht konsequentes Training. Erfahrung im Umgang mit unsicheren Hunden ist für seine zukünftigen Menschen daher wichtig.
Für Tobi suchen wir ein liebevolles, erfahrenes Zuhause, in dem er Sicherheit, klare Strukturen und ausreichend Beschäftigung findet. Wer ihm mit Ruhe und Verständnis begegnet, wird in ihm einen loyalen und fröhlichen Begleiter gewinnen.
Vorgesehen sind mindestens drei Besuche auf dem Sonnenhof. Diese Besuche liegen uns am Herzen, denn in dieser Zeit können Sie Ihren potenziellen Schützling, und er Sie, kennenlernen. Bevor der Hund dann schließlich bei Ihnen einziehen kann, führen wir eine Vorkontrolle bei Ihnen zuhause durch.

description: Ylva came to our animal shelter from Romania at the beginning of the year. The 7-year-old dog is a true dream dog. She loves people and walks well on a leash. She loves being outdoors and enjoys long walks and hikes. She ignores cars and other dogs. She loves to cuddle and enjoys being petted. She also learns incredibly quickly and always has her owner in mind. We can easily imagine Ylva in a family with little dog experience who is willing to give a not-so-young dog a loving and reliable home. Young-at-heart retirees who spend a lot of time outdoors and with whom Ylva could learn a lot of new things would also certainly be a good fit. If you are interested, simply send a short email to buero@tierheim-tuttlingen.de and arrange a meeting.

Zabou has been waiting for a suitable home for some time.
He is very affectionate and cuddly with people he knows.
He is an insecure dog who prefers to steer clear of the situation.
Zabou is looking for a quiet, rural home in a small family household, without many visitors.

Fritzi – A Broken Soul Seeks Support and a Heart
Fritzi is no easy task – but for the right person, he could be the greatest gift. This impressive mix of Great Dane, Labrador, and Malinois has clearly experienced a lot of bad things in his life so far. His trust in people has been shaken, and he shows this clearly when strangers get too close.
Fritzi reacts very sensitively to anything he perceives as a threat. Harsh, loud voices or careless movements like raising a hand can trigger fear in him. That's why he absolutely needs a home with someone experienced in dogs, someone who understands his language, acts with foresight, and accompanies him safely through life.
Fritzi isn't looking for just anyone – he's looking for the one person who truly sees him. Give him a chance to rewrite his story.

Rufus was found in Leer, and unfortunately, no owner could be identified. Rufus is now looking for a new home.
His almost-new owner, however, regularly walks Rufus and is looking for a great family for a great dog.
Rufus's behavior is very typical of a German Shepherd. As long as he is led consistently, firmly, and calmly, he is an uncomplicated and easy-to-handle dog. However, if he feels he has to sort things out on his own, he will display undesirable behavior (e.g., leash aggression).
Rufus reacts to movement stimuli and has difficulty dealing with hectic behavior (e.g., excited other dogs). Our dog trainer is currently working with Rufus on alternative behavior, and he is very willing to learn.

The handsome Shadow is looking for a new home with people experienced with dogs. Shadow is a very active young dog who needs plenty of exercise. He would prefer a house with a property where he can romp around. Shadow is relatively compatible with other dogs. On walks, Shadow is not a problem with other dogs, but we see him as an only dog in his new home. Shadow needs people who can give him clear rules and set boundaries; otherwise, he likes to resolve situations on his own and can be very protective. We would like Shadow to live in a quiet household without children.

Charming, more charming, Goliath! He comes from an inheritance and needs a moment to gain trust in people. But once he does, he's a loyal companion who doesn't miss a cuddle. Belly rubs, requests to play, and happy dances are the order of the day.
In stressful situations, Goliath becomes insecure, but is easily motivated with treats and enjoys learning new things. If he does steal a blanket or something similar, you can negotiate a trade with him for sausages, so he'll give it back. Classic ball games aren't really his thing. A long walk with a dip in the lake is more appealing to this water lover.
Goliath currently lives with other dogs, which is why a home with a confident, relaxed female dog is also an option for him. We are looking for people with experience with dogs who are both empathetic and have the necessary consistency to provide structure for this little rascal. Children should not live in the household.
If you would like to meet Goliath or have any questions, please contact his animal caretakers at +49 30 76888-204 or fill out the form below. Please plan several visits to the shelter to get to know him. We look forward to hearing from you.

Ted has been found. This handsome little fellow is very lively and still quite unruly. He gets very stressed around other dogs and doesn't particularly like them. However, he is house-trained and knows basic commands. Although he is people-oriented, he enjoys testing himself out on them. Attending dog training is therefore urgently required. Due to his breed, imitation hunting games are taboo for him.
We are looking for people with experience with this breed for Ted. He needs a quiet environment; city life is not for him at all. His new home should not include children, cats, or other animals. Please also note that due to his breed, Ted is subject to muzzle and leash requirements, and landlord approval is required for his ownership.
If you would like to meet Ted or have any questions about him, please contact his animal caretakers at +49 30 76888-204 or fill out the form below. We look forward to your inquiry.

Beau is a rather insecure dog who tends to cover this insecurity by being aggressive. Once you gain his trust, he is docile and open. To gain this trust, a very calm, confident demeanor is required from the owner(s). Insecurity and hectic behavior are quickly transferred to him, which is why Beau cannot be rehomed to dog beginners or families with children. He already has a near-perfect grasp of the basics of dog training. Due to his insecurity around people, he wears a muzzle on walks, but he is already very accustomed to it. He is very friendly and interested towards other dogs, but here, too, sympathy is the deciding factor.

Manouka didn't have an easy start in life. She is the only one of her litter to survive. She was also born with only one eye. However, this small disability doesn't bother her at all.


Manouka is very eager to learn and already knows a few basic commands. However, her new owners should be prepared for the fact that Manouka still needs further training due to her young age. She also shouldn't be left alone in her new home right away. Manouka needs patience and time to adjust to her new owners' everyday life.
Other dogs are very important to Manouka. She loves being surrounded by her canine friends and loves to romp and play. Other dogs also provide her with a lot of security and guidance, so we would like to find her a home where a confident dog already lives.

Günni is in a class of his own: As a very insecure and easily overexcited dog, he was returned from adoption after more than a year. Due to insecurity, Günni strode forward strongly and couldn't take a calm step outside. He barked loudly at everything and everyone.
From the very beginning, Günni couldn't calmly step out of the front door because everything in the city stressed him out (children, people, bicycles). He is a bit more relaxed in a rural setting.
He can be met in Varlosen by appointment. If you are interested, a detailed interview will be arranged. Contact Martina Achilles at 0162-7100897 or via email at aktivverein@aktiv-fuer-hunde-in-not.de

Dear two-legged friends, this is me, and my name is Yuki!

SOS Vergessene Pfoten
Hallo ihr Lieben, ich bin Bandina, ein junges Hundemädchen mit weichem, dreifarbigem Fell und großen Kulleraugen, die direkt in die Herzen schauen. Laut Tierarzt wurde ich im Mai 2025 geboren. Mit meinen etwa 35 cm bin ich noch klein, werde aber später zu einer mittelgroßen Hündin (ca. 40–48 cm) heranwachsen. Ich bin ein sanftes, freundliches Wesen und brauche Menschen, die mir Zeit geben, in Ruhe anzukommen. Die Welt ist für mich noch neu. Fremde Situationen, laute Geräusche oder schnelle Bewegungen können mich verunsichern. Menschen finde ich grundsätzlich toll und ich fasse relativ schnell Vertrauen, doch plötzliche Bewegungen oder Berührungen von oben machen mir noch ein bisschen Angst. Mit Geduld, Liebe und einem ruhigen Umfeld werde ich aber sicher schnell lernen, dass ich nichts zu befürchten habe. Mit anderen Hunden verstehe ich mich gut, allerdings neige ich dazu, meine Bezugsperson sehr für mich zu beanspruchen. Deshalb wäre es schön, wenn keine weiteren Hunde im eigenen Haushalt leben. Spaziergänge oder Treffen mit Artgenossen sind aber völlig in Ordnung. Katzen sind kein Problem für mich, mit ihnen komme ich gut zurecht. Kinder sind ebenfalls in Ordnung, solange sie ruhig, rücksichtsvoll und nicht zu hektisch sind, denn meine sensible Art möchte respektiert werden. Das Hunde 1×1 lerne ich gerade noch, aber ich gebe mir Mühe und lerne am liebsten in meinem eigenen Tempo. Ich wünsche mir ein Zuhause, in dem ich Vertrauen aufbauen darf bei Menschen, die mich nicht drängen, sondern mir zeigen, wie schön und sicher die Welt sein kann. Wenn du das Gefühl hast, dass wir zusammenpassen könnten, dann melde dich gern bei mir.
Vermittelt werde ich mit einem Schutzvertrag und gegen eine Schutzgebühr von 550,- EUR. Ich bin selbstverständlich geimpft, gechipt und entwurmt und bereits bei Tasso registriert. Du kannst bei uns im Verein für mich ein passendes Sicherheitsgeschirr, normales Geschirr, Halsband und Leine neuwertig erwerben. Dieses Starterpaket sorgt dafür, dass ich mich von Anfang an sicher, geborgen und gut versorgt fühle.
Wir würden uns sehr freuen, wenn Ihr uns in der Facebookgruppe, auf Instagram und TikTok folgt. Dort bekommt Ihr viele Einblicke in unsere Arbeit, den Verein und natürlich über unsere Fellnasen.

Geb. 11/ 2020, ca. 48cm, ca.18 kg, kastriert
Zsömi ist gut auf seiner Pflegestelle angekommen und sucht jetzt seine „Für-Immer-Familie“.
Zsömi ist ein freundlicher, menschenbezogener Rüde, der sehr sehr gerne kuschelt. Kinder mag er sehr gerne. Er fährt geduldig im Auto mit und kann darin auch dort ruhig warten, wenn man mal was einkaufen geht. Auch zu Hause bleibt er stundenweise alleine und ist natürlich stubenrein. Der klugen, neugierige Junge mag alle Aktivitäten, er ist intelligent, lernwillig und interessiert und geht prima an der Leine. Er möchte mit seinen Menschen was erleben, ist agil und fit. Im Haus kann er gut entspannen und schläft nachts durch.

Hello dear people, my name is Joy, and I'm a little girl with a big, loving heart. My estimated due date, according to the vet, is July 2025. I'm currently about 29 cm tall, but one day I'll grow into a wonderful medium-sized dog of about 40-50 cm. My journey here hasn't been easy, as I come from a kill shelter – a place where fear and hopelessness are palpable every day. But I was rescued, and for that I am incredibly grateful and ready to start a new life. My soft, black and white fur is perfect for petting, but the most precious thing about me is my gentle, quiet nature. I'm still shy and sometimes fearful, because I had to endure so much before I was even allowed to be a puppy. But I want to learn, to trust, to become brave – step by step, by your side. Every gentle touch, every kind word, and every little moment of security means so much to me. If you show me how beautiful life can be and teach me the basics of being a dog, I promise you that I will grow with love, trust, and devotion. I get along well with other dogs and cats, and despite my insecurity, I greet people with cautious openness and a gentle wag of my tail full of hope. Children are welcome in my new home, as long as they treat my delicate heart gently and lovingly. My greatest wish is for a home where I can truly arrive—a place where I am loved, find comfort when I am scared, and explore the world with you. I long for warmth, security, closeness, and people who accept me just as I am. Perhaps you are the very people who will finally give my little heart a home. I'm waiting for you with great hope.
I'm being rehomed through the animal welfare organization SOS Vergessene Pfoten Tierschutz e.V. with a protection contract and for a protection fee of €550. I am, of course, vaccinated, microchipped, dewormed, and already registered with Tasso. You can purchase a suitable, like-new safety harness and leash for me from our organization. This starter kit will ensure that I feel safe, secure, and well cared for from the very beginning.

Achtung; Achtung – hier kommt Rakete! Als ungebändigte, junge Terrierhündin trat Rakete plötzlich und mit voller Wucht in das zuvor so ruhige Leben ihrer Vorbesitzerin. Der gute Wille und die Hilfsbereitschaft, die sie anfangs überzeugte, die junge Hündin bei sich aufzunehmen, reichten schlussendlich leider nicht aus, um Rakete das zu bieten, was sie wirklich braucht.
Wer die Vorurteile gegenüber Terriern kennt wird in der Patterdale Hündin ein gefundenes Fressen finden - denn ja, das Kopfkino beim Stichwort „Terrier“ erfüllt sie in vielen Punkten mit Gusto. „Vorwärts immer – rückwärts nimmer“ nahm sich das schwarze Duracellhäschen besonders zu Herzen und wurde unter anderem durch kopfloses Bällchen werfen weiterhin in ihrer Rastlosigkeit und Hektik bestärkt. An Pausenzeiten und Ruhe war in der Vergangenheit nicht zu denken und so nutzen wir die Eingewöhnungszeit und damit verbundenen „Startschwierigkeiten“, um dem Gaspedal eine kleine Pause zu gönnen.
Der Umzug ins Tierheim und die klare Führung brachten einen kleinen Reset mit sich. Besonders in den ersten Tagen und Wochen fiel es ihr schwer Fuß zu fassen und sich einzuleben, denn hinter der harten Schale steckt eigentlich ein recht weicher, sanfter Kern. Besonders in ihrer gewohnten Umgebung zeigt sich Rakete als wahre Kuschelmaus und funktioniert den Schoss ihrer Menschen schnell zum Körbchen um. Auch in neuen Situationen sucht sie inzwischen Rückhalt bei ihren Menschen und findet diesen auch schnell in Berührungen, was man sich im Training zu Nutze machen kann. Stichwort Stimmungsübertragung lässt sich Rakete so relativ schnell von der äußeren Aufregung aber auch von ausgestrahlter Ruhe anstecken – Körperkontakt hilft ihr zusätzlich dabei, sich selbst regulieren zu können.
In gewohnten Situationen und besonders reizarmer Umgebung reichen bereits ein sanfter Impuls und Ansprache aus, um die feinfühlige Dame ansprechbar und in der Spur zu halten. Natürlich gibt es auch immer wieder laute, aufregende Momente, in denen es noch schwerer wird, in Kommunikation zu bleiben, doch mit weiterem Training wird es auch hier immer besser. Terrier bleibt auch nach viel Arbeit eben Terrier – und die Stimme ihr Weg, um Stress abzulassen.

German Shepherd Haribo, at a young age, already has to make up for the lack of impulse control caused by his previous owners. The young dog was spontaneously purchased in Romania as a future companion for the family's children. Now, however, the little guy isn't so little anymore, and the family's interest in this time-consuming canine hasn't kept pace.
In the meantime, the adorable Haribo has grown into a considerable giant who, unfortunately, hasn't been able to gain much maturity or calmness in recent weeks. As a result of his genetic predisposition and the lack of training, he is now a very restless, easily excitable dog who can hardly settle down and catch his breath. Typical of German Shepherds, he is still eager to learn, and the first signs of progress aren't long in coming, but the list of homework assignments from dog training school is still long.
Being left alone and tolerating frustration are particularly difficult for Haribo. Judging by his thick fur and his behavior so far in his foster home, he likely spent most of his time outside a home environment, kept outdoors in a kennel. The fact that muddy paws don't belong on the tabletop and that there are different surfaces besides grass and stone is completely foreign to him. Even though Haribo still lacks a certain amount of basic training, it's immediately obvious that life in a home is completely new territory for him, and he's not using it as an opportunity to test his boundaries. This makes it all the more important to quickly find a suitable home so that more intensive training can begin. Haribo is only 6 months old and is still growing, both mentally and physically. Especially with dogs of this size, meticulous work is essential to ensure he becomes a manageable and controllable dog in the future. Only then can he become a reliable companion for his humans, without being overly stressed or agitated by external influences.
